captions.text: Good evening Ladies and Gentlemen! As some of you might already know

today's flight is going to be unique. We
will be flying a little detour over Iceland

to chase the core of the tomorrow's total
solar eclipse above the clouds.
I wish you a pleasant stay on board.
Just relax, lean back and enjoy the flight.
It's very ambitious to reach or to
to meet the core of the solar eclipse.
We can not make any delay for this. We have to depart

Chicago on time and we have to land in
Munich on time
and in between we want to reach the core (of the total solar eclipse).

We are three hundred miles south of
Iceland, four hundred miles west of Scotland.
We are just about to enter the core of the eclipse.

title: Total Solar Eclipse 2015 - Lufthansa flight LH 435 delivers a view from the stratosphere

comments.author: Natkritta Panprasert

comments.text:
+Renat Yakubov Yeah, 6 years ago but I feel like it very long time ago. :)
Thank you for your information, if I have a chance I will be there. :)
comments.author: Natkritta Panprasert

comments.text:
Huh, that's not so many years ago :) And the path of that eclipse is 
well-known to me, I was considering visiting China to see it. Totality 
lasted more than 6 minutes, that's extremely long. In  Novosibirsk 2008 or 
in Svalbard - 2015 it lasted less than two minutes and a half, for example.
And yes, eclipse 2016 is a good chance for you, as a next totality in your 
region will occur only in year 2023, again in Indonesia.
comments.author: Renat Yakubov

comments.text:
+Renat Yakubov I saw it in the morning 22 July 2009 in Bangkok. :) 
Next time in Indonesia, now I have not any plan to go to there. But it 
sounds interesting. :)
comments.author: Natkritta Panprasert

comments.text:
Which year was it, if it's not a secret? I want to see moon shadow path on 
a map for that eclipse :)
By the way, in a year 2016 there will be a totality not that far from you 
again, in Indonesia. Don't you have any plans to visit this neighboring 
country that time, or will you prefer to see partial phases from Bangkok?
comments.author: Renat Yakubov

comments.text:
+Renat Yakubov Yes, I saw it in Thailand for many years ago. It was a great 
experience.
comments.author: Natkritta Panprasert

comments.text:
Here in Russia there were a dedicated flight to the zone of total solar 
eclipse :) Unfortunately, I got information about it only when all seats to 
the right board of a plane - where you would actually see a totality - were 
sold already. Happily I've already seen this magnificent event from the 
ground in year 2008, but I definitely want to see it again :)
comments.author: Renat Yakubov
